block.p: Tanya Rulon-Miller and Stephen Michael Schlemmer were married yesterday in Northeast Harbor, Me., by the Rev. Dr. John L. Schmidt, a Presbyterian minister.

The bride, 29, is a freelance journalist in London. She graduated from Cornell University. She is the daughter of Linn Sage Rulon-Miller and Sumner Rulon-Miller III, both of New York. Her mother works in New York as a freelance photographer. Her father is the chairman of Rulon-Miller, an employee benefits and estate-planning insurance broker in New York. The bride is the stepdaughter of Elena P. Rulon-Miller, a painter.
Tanya Rulon-Miller and Stephen Michael Schlemmer were married yesterday in Northeast Harbor, Me., by the Rev. Dr. John L. Schmidt, a Presbyterian minister.

The bride, 29, is a freelance journalist in London. She graduated from Cornell University. She is the daughter of Linn Sage Rulon-Miller and Sumner Rulon-Miller III, both of New York. Her mother works in New York as a freelance photographer. Her father is the chairman of Rulon-Miller, an employee benefits and estate-planning insurance broker in New York. The bride is the stepdaughter of Elena P. Rulon-Miller, a painter.

The bridegroom, 30, is a vice president in the European stocks department in London for Credit Suisse First Boston. He graduated from Dartmouth College. He is a son of Carla K. and Dennis R. Schlemmer of Barrington Hills, Ill. His mother is a lawyer in Barrington Hills, and his father is a partner in Leydig, Voit & Mayer, a law firm in Chicago.
